No deals expected tonight, but Mets are working the phones for relievers and will trade for at least 1 or 2 before long.

Among the extra arms the Mets are bringing to Miami are Stephen Nogosek and lefty Sam Clay.

Nogosek, who figures to be at least a short-term Drew Smith replacement, has been as dominant at Triple-A (0.99 ERA) as he was in the Majors (0.71 ERA).

The Smith news, which @Ken_Rosenthal first reported, underscores the Mets' need for bullpen deadline help. They've lost two useful arms in Smith and Colin Holderman in recent days.

Good news is there's a ton of inventory out there. Expect the Mets to land one (or more) RP soon.
